data.title: Beach Parking Information
data.text:
Residents Beach Parking Permits

Collier County residents are eligible for a free beach parking permit upon proof of residency. A beach parking sticker may be obtained at any of our County Park Community Center locations.

Beach Parking Stickers Locations:

Collier County Tax Collector (Main Government Complex) – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-5:00pm

3291 Tamiami Trail East, Naples

Donna Fiala Eagle Lakes Community Park (Fitness Center) – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-7:00pm; Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

11565 Tamiami Trail East, Naples

East Naples Community Park – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-7:00pm; Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

3500 Thomasson Drive, Naples

Fred W Coyle Freedom Park – Tuesday thru Saturday: 9:00am-2:00pm

1515 Golden Gate Parkway, Naples

Golden Gate Community Center – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-7:00pm; Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

4701 Golden Gate Parkway, Naples

Immokalee Community Park – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-7:00pm; Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

321 North 1st Street, Immokalee

Marco Island Branch Library – Monday thru Thursday: 10:00am-6:00pm; Friday & Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

210 S. Heathwood Drive, Marco Island

Max A. Hasse Jr. Community Park – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-7:00pm; Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

3390 Golden Gate Boulevard West, Naples

Naples Regional Library – Monday thru Thursday: 9:00am-8:00pm; Friday & Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

650 Central Avenue, Naples

North Collier Regional Park Exhibit Hall – Monday thru Friday: 8:00am-4:30pm

15000 Livingston Road, Naples

Orange Blossom Government Center – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-5:00pm

2335 Orange Blossom Drive, Naples

Veterans Community Park – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-7:00pm; Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

1895 Veterans Park Drive, Naples

Vineyards Community Park – Monday thru Friday: 9:00am-7:00pm; Saturday: 9:00am-5:00pm

6231 Arbor Boulevard, Naples

Placement Instructions:

The permit must be permanently adhered to the driver’s side lower left corner of the windshield to be valid. No tape or lamination. You may adhere these on rental cars, if you have permission from the rental company, however Collier County is not responsible for damage charges.

Permits may not be moved from one vehicle to another. The permit must remain with the vehicle with which it was registered.

Residents are required to provide documentation proving their residency. Read the below list.

Full time Residents must provide the following to obtain a parking permit:

Original current Collier County Vehicle Registration (copies not accepted)

Original current Collier County Drivers License (copies not accepted)

Both documents must display the same name and Collier County residence address

Part time Resident Property Owners must provide the following to obtain a parking sticker:

Valid Driver’s License (regardless of state)

Valid vehicle registration/rental car agreement

Current Collier County proper tax bill or Warranty Deed, within 3 months of closing

All 3 documents must display the property owner’s name

Mobile Home Owners please note:

Mobile Home Owners must own the land the home is on if they are a part time resident in order to qualify for the property tax paid beach permit with no payment required at the time of pickup

Taxes paid on land do not qualify the payer as an ‘property owner’, even if they own the mobile home the land rests on.

Full time residents living in mobile homes may obtain a beach parking permit.

Mobile Pay To Park

This is only for Collier County visitors who are not eligible for a free Collier County Resident Beach Parking Permit.

Mobile Pay To Park Information

Need to Contact us? Call 239.252.4000
